rationales.security: She accepts inefficient earnings and an irregular schedule to keep volunteering, trading away financial stability.
rationales.universalism: She donates coats and prioritizes newcomer support work at the settlement center and legal clinic.
She helped a refugee family by connecting them to a tax clinic resource and values their successful outcome.

rationales.security: She hesitates to join organizing meetings to protect limited time for sleep and avoid overcommitment.
rationales.universalism: Her conflict centers on helping two broader groups, underpaid drivers and newcomers at the legal clinic.

rationales.self_direction: She intentionally chooses flexible gig work so she can decide her schedule around urgent community needs.
rationales.security: She rejects the stability of a regular job despite financial pressure in order to stay available for others.
rationales.conformity: She resists the social expectation that only a conventional full-time job counts as legitimate work.
rationales.universalism: She prioritizes translation and legal-navigation help for vulnerable families when institutions are hard to access.

rationales.self_direction: She structures her life around what she believes matters rather than others' career scripts.
rationales.achievement: She explicitly deprioritizes career trajectory and advancement metrics compared with service impact.
rationales.security: She knowingly accepts lower income and less stability to continue settlement center work.
rationales.universalism: Her motivation is helping immigrant families navigate rights and systems, prioritizing broad human welfare.

rationales.security: She remains financially precarious, considering extra overnight shifts while rent is due and earnings were lost.
rationales.universalism: Even under stress she affirms that center work still matters because institutions harm vulnerable people.

rationales.self_direction: She recommits to her chosen path based on personal conviction rather than outside validation.
rationales.security: She accepts ongoing financial exhaustion as a tradeoff for continuing this work.
rationales.universalism: She invests time helping a refugee family with citizenship prep and frames solidarity as a collective responsibility.

rationales.hedonism: She repeatedly forgoes rest and personal comfort, taking more work even when depleted.
rationales.security: Running on exhaustion and stitching income sources signals unsustainable personal and financial stability.
rationales.benevolence: She leaves close ties unattended, with messages from her mom and friend unread due chronic overload.
rationales.universalism: She extends her day to triage overflow legal-clinic cases for people who need urgent support.

rationales.self_direction: She sets her own boundaries, taking a break and giving an honest limited commitment to organizing.
rationales.hedonism: She intentionally restores herself through sleep, cooking, and reconnection rather than constant overwork.
rationales.security: She reframes rest as necessary maintenance to sustain functioning and avoid burnout.
rationales.universalism: She remains committed to helping newcomers and workers while accepting realistic limits on what one person can fix.
